p: Finally, while Devisetti et al. [ 92] evaluated the effect of Moringa oleifera leaf flour in sandwiches reaching similar conclusions, the protein content in puffed sandwiches increased, presenting 21.6 g in 100 g of product; while dietary fibre was presented at 14.8 g per 100 g of product, there was also a reduction in fat content of 3.7 g per 100 g of product with a high presence of phenolic compounds and flavonoids. In relation to the sensory characteristics of the sandwiches, an acceptable result was obtained in terms of texture [ 92].
